fields.description:
When creating several projects a day, sometimes it can be a real pain to select all the schemes per project. What I am suggesting is that Atlassian create a Project Configuration Scheme system that you configure all of the following information:
Issue Type Scheme 
Notification Scheme
Permission Scheme
Issue Security Scheme
Field Configuration Scheme
Issue Type Screen Scheme
Workflow Scheme

And allow you to assign all of those to a project in a single selection of Project Configuration Scheme from the project admin screen. That way you can setup many projects quickly.
fields.summary: Project Configuration Scheme System

fields.description:
The only way for the moment to enable/disable commenting on an issue is by configuring a permission scheme. It should be nice to disable commenting depending on the issue status and the user role.

f.e. disable commeting on closed issues for regular users, but enable this option for administrators.
fields.summary: Disable commenting
Extend a feature to download support packages
Transform Version Description field in Free Text field

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Download the attached [attachment|^12109_2.JPG]
2. Attach it to an issue
3. The issue's activity tab will be showing this [error|^activityTab.png]. Same problem goes to Activity Stream gadget.

A workaround at the moment is to disable the Thumnail images via _Administration -> Global Settings -> Attachments_
fields.summary: Broken Thumbnail Attachment causes Activity Stream to break

fields.description:
As Described here  [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Viewing+User+Sessions] viewing User Sessions is useful if you need to know who to contact before planned downtime. 

Can we have a button that grabs the emails of all the logged in users and populates the "Send Email" page in the Administration console OR copies them to the clip board so we can paste them into our email client and mail them from their.

Send Email may need to be modified to accept individual email accounts rather than groups or roles (the way it currently works)


Why? So admins can email all logged in users and warn them of an unscheduled outage.
fields.summary: Combine Current User Sessions in JIRA with Send Email Functionality

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Install JIRA on a system with locale not supported by JIRA.
2. Login to JIRA. Click on "Create Issue" link.
3. Click on "Calendar" icon in create issue form.

Result:
1. user get an alert message "JIRA Calendar doesn't support your language". Click ok.
2. User get  a javascript error "Line: 1
Error: 'this.table.style' is null or not an object"
fields.summary: Clicking on calendar icon throw javascript error if the user language/locale is not supported by calendar.
edit-searcher/search-radio.vm [line 10,column 16] : ${checked} is not a valid reference.

fields.description:
When fixing JRA-20528 a new way of loading workflow component was introduced. It relies on those components being registered as plugins. It prevents usage of any such components defined in core JIRA libraries, e.g. by loading a custom workflow XML. Examples:
* {{BeanShellCondition}} from OSWorkflow
* {{UberIssueWorkflowFunction}} from JIRA core

This also makes JIRA 4.1.2 incompatible with previous versions and may cause problems during upgrades of instances with custom workflows.
fields.summary: JIRA does not load workflow components (functions, conditions, validators) from the core libraries

fields.description:
Step to reproduce:

# Start entering some content into Comment (without submitting it).
# Navigate to Log Work and enter it.
# Submit the Log Work Form.
# 'Confusing' message referring to the content in Comment is displayed
!LogWork_NavigateAway.png!
# 'Cancel' navigation away.
# Option to submit logged work is going to be disabled.
!GreyedoutLog.png!
fields.summary: Confusing Log Work screen freezes on navigate away

fields.description: This is a request to create a separate Release Notes text field (box). Currently, the Release Notes details are entered in the Comments, using a specific text string (RN:). Since, the colon punctuation mark is not a special character that is supported for text searching, it is cumbersome to search for bugs that contain specifically the (RN:) text string. Also, if a separate Release Notes field (box) is available, it should also be configurable by using the Tools > Configure Columns feature. As a result, one can search for any bugs which contain any, or specific text in the Release Notes field (box) and also configure the result of the query to display the contents of the Release Notes field (box). Previous in-house bug tracking systems (Mantis or ITS) contain a separate Release Notes field, so it should be possible to add one to the JIRA bug tracking system.
fields.summary: Request to add create a separate Release Notes field (box)
Request to add the colon punctuation mark (:) to the list of special characters supported for text searching

fields.summary: AttachScreenshot-Java-Applet does upload the screenshot but redirects to a wrong url

fields.description:
OSWorkflow implements several built-in components (functions, conditions, validators) integrating with e.g.:
* JNDI
* EJB
* Beanshell

While most of them is of arguable value, JIRA used to be able to successfully look up and instantiate them. While fixing JRA-20528 a bug was introduced in that JIRA no longer resolves those built-in components. The affected code is in {{DefaultOSWorkflowConfigurator}}. As a result, custom workflows using those facilities will face errors that will break their workflows. Note that those components are not used withing default JIRA workflows.
fields.summary: Undocumented dropped support for built-in OsWorkflow components in JIRA 4.1.2

fields.description:
On upgrading a customer's JIRA instance to JIRA 4.2.2 I found the error message below. The download area (http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/JIRADownloadCenter.jspa) lists the JIRA release date as 04/Jan/2011, not 22/Dec/10. It might stop customers from upgrading if their maintenance expires after 22/Dec/10 but before 04/Jan/2011.


Error message:
{noformat}
Confirm New Installation

This version of JIRA (4.2.2-b589 - build #589) was created on 22/Dec/10.

JIRA support and updates for this license ended on 22/Oct/10. JIRA updates created after 22/Oct/10 are not valid for this license.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Incorrect build date for JIRA 4.2.2

fields.description:
Hi,

I have been working on integrating a Test management tool (www.testlodge.com) with JIRA using the REST api and just have a few questions that I was hoping you could help with.

1. Creating a ticket - Is there a way to make a POST request to create a ticket? If not is this a feature that will be added anytime soon or is there a work-around? This is one of the most important actions and without it the API is of no use.

2. More general feedback as its not critical, but it would be nice to have an action that allows me to list all the available projects in the account / or that the user has access to. I guess I would expect the response to only contain summary data such as name and project key.

Thanks
Scott Sherwood
fields.summary: JIRA REST api questions / feedback

fields.description:
JIRA converted Time Tracking field which is Original Estimate to hours even though the Format used is Day. So far, this is tested against JIRA 4.1.2, JIRA 4.2.1 


To replicate this problem with Hours Per Day=8:
# Enable Time Tracking and set the Hours Per Day equal to 8
# Choose Day Format
# Create a ticket and set the Original Estimate to 0.1d. The value will remain as 0.1d.
# Create a ticket and set the Original Estimate to 0.125d. The value will be converted to 1h
# Create a ticket and set the Original Estimate to 0.25d. The value will remain as 0.25d

\\
To replicate this problem with Hours Per Day=24:
# Enable Time Tracking and set the Hours Per Day equal to 24
# Choose Day Format
# Create a ticket and set the Original Estimate to 0.1d. The value will remain as 0.1d.
# Create a ticket and set the Original Estimate to 0.125d. The value will be converted to 3h
# Create a ticket and set the Original Estimate to 0.25d. The value will remain as 0.25d

\\
To replicate this problem with Hours Per Day=6:
# Enable Time Tracking and set the Hours Per Day equal to 6
# Choose Day Format
# Create a ticket and set the Original Estimate to 0.1d. The value will remain as 0.1d.
# Create a ticket and set the Original Estimate to 0.125d. The value will be converted to 0.75h
# Create a ticket and set the Original Estimate to 0.25d. The value will remain as 0.25d


\\
On related note, JIRA will throw the following System Error if the Hours Per Day is 7.5 and the value is set to "0.125d":
{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Error occurred while converting time estimates:Specified decimal fraction duration cannot maintain precision
{noformat}
fields.summary: Time Tracking Field Value With 3 Decimals  Point is  Converted To Hours When Time Tracking Format Is Day
Localise durations for time estimates

fields.description:
Guys - the JIRA Web Fragments doco is waaay out of date. Anyone trying to write a JIRA plugin is _really_ going to struggle to get UX fragments working right now.

Public document for external developers is [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Web+Fragments]. Needless, it's not so useful right now - and given this is the most important plugin module, we need to fix it.

Internal doc is [here on EAC|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/web-sections+and+web-items+in+JIRA] which includes screenshots, up to date section/fragment locations etc.

Please update.
fields.summary: JIRA Web Fragments document vastly out of date
Deleting or creating a dashboard redirects you to the login page if you are not part of the 'jira-users' group.
recycle bin for jira projects

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce* 
 When you have some issue fields that contains text starting with a dash "-" and then export the issue to excel, They will be treated as numeric types. Whenever you try to make amends on them and hit the "Enter" key, it behaves in an awkward manner. File test.xls illustrates this phenomena on "description field".

*Workaround:* 
A workaround to this is to add a non breakable space if the description contains a dash character.
edit the file  WEB-INF\classes\templates\jira\issue\field\description-columnview.vm to be as thus:
{noformat}
#if ($description)
  #if (${displayParams.excel_view})
    #if ($description.contains("-"))
        
    #end
    $textutils.br($textutils.htmlEncode($description, false))
  #else
    $rendererManager.getRenderedContent($fieldLayoutItem, $issue)
  #end
#end
{noformat}
fields.summary: Issue fields of type text such as description exported to excel are treated as numeric if their first character starts with a dash "-".

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23494].
  {panel}

Using something like GreenHopper or the SOAP API, an issue can be created or edited to have a newline (i.e. "\n") character in the issue summary.

This causes problems with plain text and HTML email notifications because the newline is not stripped out. Therefore the "Subject:" email header line will be split in such a way that the data section will start prematurely.

Here is a script to create a sample issue:

{code:none}
#!/usr/bin/env ruby
require 'rubygems'
gem 'soap4r'
require 'soap/wsdlDriver'

soap = SOAP::WSDLDriverFactory.new('http://localhost:8080/rpc/soap/jirasoapservice-v2?wsdl').create_rpc_driver
token = soap.login('admin', 'password')
issue_map = {
  :type => "1",
  :project => "TST",
  :summary => "This test issue has a newline\nafter the first occurrence of the word 'newline'",
  :description => "This is the description.",
  :assignee => "admin"
  };
issue = soap.createIssue(token, issue_map);
{code}

The resulting email has the subject "[JIRA] Created: (TST-4) This test issue has a newline" and the body looks like:

{noformat}
after the
first occurrence of the word 'newline'
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Precedence: bulk
Auto-Submitted: auto-generated
X-JIRA-FingerPrint: dee9d5d26e4e05c908d4fd9475e805a2

<html>
<head>
   <!--
   You are receiving this email because you have chosen HTML as your email preference.
   ...
{noformat}

This is because the headers contain the following:

{noformat}From: "Admin (JIRA)" <mknight@atlassian.com>
To: mknight@atlassian.com
Message-ID: <2135917781.11.1295508323968.JavaMail.mknight@kitt.sydney.atlassian.com>
Subject: [JIRA] Created: (TST-4) This test issue has a newline

after the
 first occurrence of the word 'newline'
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Precedence: bulk
Auto-Submitted: auto-generated
X-JIRA-FingerPrint: dee9d5d26e4e05c908d4fd9475e805a2

<html>
<head>
    <!--
    You are receiving this email because you have chosen HTML as your email preference.
    ...
{noformat}

The example here shows HTML emails, which are significantly affected because the HTML will not be rendered. It will just look like a plain text email full of mark-up.
fields.summary: Issues can have a newline in the summary, which results in malformed email notifications
The worklog id should not be shown in the history tab on the view issue page and should not appear in email notfications

fields.description: The index optimization in JIRA is scheduled after a given (configurable, 4000 by default) number of updates to a given index. The logic behind introduces a race condition in that multiple optimizations may be scheduled after the threshold was exceeded once. This may happen if there is more than one simultaneous request that results in update of given index (e.g. multiple create/edit issue requests for issue index). This generally slows down index updates and affects overall throughput of JIRA. Together with JRA-21578 this _may_ potentially lead to serious performance degradation under some very specific circumstances.
fields.summary: Race condition in the index optimization logic

fields.description:

2.- Go to any form where we use the calendar widget (Add Version, Edit Issue, Create Worklog, Edit Worklog).

Expected behaviour:

fields.description:
Hello,

In JIRA 4.1.2, you could have LDAP integrated with JIRA, and have users existing both in LDAP and JIRA, and only in JIRA database. While leaving the "External User Management" option ON, you could change the users' passwords in LDAP, and for the users which existed only in JIRA database, you could use ForgotLoginDetails.jspa page to reset their passwords.

However, this function is now not working on JIRA 4.2.2. If you copy the same environment as above, when trying to reach ForgotLoginDetails.jspa, you get a stacktrace on the screen.

Can this option be enabled again?

Cheers

Best Regards
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: The page "ForgotLoginDetails.jspa" doesn't work anymore when External User Management is ON and directory is read only

fields.description:
When trying to use jira in a meeting through a data projector the resolution often drops so small that for example create new issue dialog in agile tab is not usable at all because you can not access the buttons at the bottom of the dialog. There is a possibility to use keyboard shortcuts for "create", "create and close" and "cancel" but who remembers those without checking.

I think the dialog should always be smaller than the browser window. If you need to create a dialog window which is larger than the current browser window you should enlarge the browser window at the same time. Then the browser should create a scroll bar and users are able to use the dialog window.
fields.summary: Using Jira on a data projector resolution is impossible because dialog windows are too big

fields.description: See screenshot.
fields.summary: Opened Issues per project should have a capital P on Project

fields.description:
I wanted to make a bulk change (Resolved > Closed) for two issues from two different projects. I found out that you can't make a bulk change that easily in these kind of situations where the issues are from projects assigned in two different workflows (I also read the issues related to this matter from this Jira issue manager). But still I wanted to get the action done with that bulk change and I went to the next step, now making the change only for one issue per time. But I ran into a bug.

Please check out the attachment and you will see:
- "This change will affect 1 issues" and in
- "Change Fix Version(s)" there is a text: NOTE. This operation can be performed only on issues from ONE project. 

Only 1 issue can hardly be recorded in two different projects, so what's this Note for and why can't I change the fix version for only this one issue? Not that this would be a major issue for me but it is better to have as few bugs in a software as possible, right?
fields.summary: Jira thinks there are issues from different projects in bulk operation but there is only 1 issue affected

fields.description:
Since using version 4.2.2 we have the problem, that the tab views in the issues do not show the correct fields when using IE8. If you click on a tab, fields of multiple tabs are shown in the same tab and it looks like the field tabs got pasted one after the other.  
This effect can only be reproduced with IE8. It works fine with Firefox 3.6.3 so far. 

I found some correlating bugs for older versions of Jira which should be fixed since 4.2., but it looks to me that there is still a problem. 
Please find attached screenshots of ONE tab (in sequence of scrolling down the view on the screen)
fields.summary: Tab view of issues show fields of multiple tabs with IE 8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23476].
  {panel}

When I attach screenshots to a defect I have to print them individually as opposed to including them in the print view. This adds over head in defect cases where a complex workflow is being described in through a series of texts and images. 

I've attached the print view for a sample defect (excuse the text therein - it was a colleagues test defect).

Ideally I'd like to be able to enable or disable the inclusion of images on a print view. 

Regards,
Richard
fields.summary: Option to enable or disable the image attachments for printing

fields.description:
Steps:

1.- Go to an issue with sub-tasks and click on the "+" icon to display the quick create sub-task form.
2.- Enter some text in the summary field.
3.- Click on "Cancel", the form will close.
4.- Click on the "+" icon again.
5.- *[BUG]* Notice that the text you entered in step 2 is still present in the summary field.

Expected Behaviour:

The summary field should be blank in step 5. All form values should be at their default on step 5.
fields.summary: The quick create sub-task form does not clear the content when clicking on the cancel button

fields.description:
Hi,

it would be great if we were able to add a variable in a custom field, and substitute it with another custom field content on the same issue. For example, we have an issue to upgrade a software, this issue has two custom fields with these names: 

- "Final version" (the final version of upgrade)
- "How-to upgrade" (the steps to complete the upgrade)

In the how-to we would write something like this:

- Delete /some/path content
- Copy CVS version ${Final version} to /some/path
- Restart service XXX

This is useful in case we have long text custom fields with predefined content, and this way we wouldn't need to modify it when creating new issues.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Substitutions in custom fields using variables

fields.description:
We have several product revisions. It would be helpful if the revision number could be used in the project key.
For exemple we now have the key PFW which is the firmware for the first generation of product P. We like to have keys P2FW, P3FW, etc. for the next generations.
fields.summary: Allow digits in project keys
Export PortletConfigurationStore to plugins

fields.description:
When the AJAX call by one of the plugins fails, the error message replaces the content of the project tab. This can be quite unfortunate when the user tries to view the project page where the error from the plugin's AJAX call can be pretty much ignored.

See [AGMP-631|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/AGMP-631].
fields.summary: The browse project page's error handling javascript handles plugin's ajax calls, and replaces the content of the project tab with error messages.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23468].
  {panel}

During an upgrade from Jira 3.13.4 to 4.2.2, I couldn't help but notice that issue re-indexing was carried out 4/5 times
The first re-index is carried out immediately after data import, then a number of upgrade tasks run, 3 or 4 of which carry out issue re-index again.
Our system has 200,000+ issues in it, and each index job takes approx 90-100 minutes.
Perhaps all of the re-index jobs are needed, but I can't think of a reason why any more than one re-index would be needed?
Can Atlassian insert some intelligence into the upgrade process to remove all unnecessary re-index steps?
fields.summary: Jira should only re-index once during an upgrade

fields.description: Introduction gadget crops the content on Google Chrome. It happens both on my desktop and netbook. The image is "to blame". 1. Introduction gadget puts the text content into its window. 2. Chrome renders the content. However, the image has not yet been downloaded and rendered. 3. Gadget thinks everything is rendered and sets its height to X pixels. 4. The image has been downloaded. It renders. The text goes down, behind the gadget. The workaround I found out is to explicitly set .
fields.summary: introduction gadget crops the content on Google Chrome

fields.description:
In the ["Defining a Component" help page|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Component#DefiningaComponent-DefaultAssigneeOptions], under the description of the "Component Lead" option in the "Default Assignee Options", you can read:
bq.*Condition:* If the +project+ leader is not permitted to be assigned to issues....
I believe that instead you meant:
bq.*Condition:* If the +component+ leader is not permitted to be assigned to issues....
fields.summary: Cut and paste error on the "Defining a Component" documentation page

fields.description:
I cannot imagine this issue is not already reported, but I've spent 20 minutes searching and cannot find it.

We have a lot of custom fields, 870. When users are adding additional fields to be displayed in the results, it is difficult for them to find the correct one. As they are normally searching on particular project(s), most of these fields are not associated with them. I don't really understand why the scope for adding fields to be displayed does not take into account projects and issue types already selected by the filter.

This problem is compounded when there are duplicate field names, see attachment. There really is no good way to explain to users how to select the "right" field for their project.
fields.summary: When adding fields to the issue navigator display columns, restrict list to just those associated with at least one of the projects in the filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23462].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Email Filter Subscriptions are still sent after an user is marked as deactivated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an user belonging to jira-users group
# Deactivate the user
# Create a filter and subscribed to jira-users group
#* Filter used: issuekey in issueHistory() ORDER BY lastViewed DESC
#* Ticked the option to still send an email even there's no issue found.


h3. Expected Results
JIRA would send subscriptions only to active users.

h3. Actual Results
All users belonging to the jira-users group receive the filter subscription email, regardless of being deactivated.

h3. Notes
This happens both when deactivating the user by unchecking the 'Active' checkbox in the user edit screen, or removing the user from all groups.

h3. Workaround:
Some sql queries would need to remove the filter subscriptions from the database with the reference:
* http://wiki.customware.net/repository/display/ATLASSIAN/How+to+delete+filters+and+subscriptions+added+by+other+users
fields.summary: Disable all user filter subscriptions when user account is de-activated

fields.description:
When I clone issue X-1, a new issue X-2 gets created.

I expect the relation ship to say "X-1 is cloned by X-2", and "X-2 clones X-1" (i.e "the new issue is a clone of the older issue"), but Jira creates the relationship in the other direction.

Am I making wrong assumptions ?
fields.summary: The "cloner" relationship is inverted
Add comments when attachments added to issue

fields.description:
After attached a screenshot, it show as "404 not found", but the screenshot have attached.
Reproduced steps:
1. select action "attach Screenshot" in a issue.
2. paste a screenshot in the pop-up attach screenshot window
3. click attach button.
after click attach button, the page will show as "404 not found", see screenshot 
!404 not found.PNG!
fields.summary: The page show as "404 not found" after attach screenshot

fields.description: there are only components and versions on project level. we need to user-defined custom fields on project level
fields.summary: Need custom fields on project level

fields.description: Urls should be built using the requestContext variable stored in the velocity context instead. This makes sure that the URLs are generated according to the current context path. The cange should be made in releasenotes-html.vm and releasenotes-text.vm
fields.summary: Release Notes Velocity Templates uses the jira.baseurl app property directly to build URLs
Improve screenshot applet error handling while submitting the screenshot
Paging for projects gadget

fields.description: I do not believe Jira has this functionality, but it would be great to enable automatic email of dashboards to an email list with set timings.
fields.summary: Ability to setup emails of dashboards to be sent out automatically

fields.description: Apparently in JIRA 3.13 we'd populate the velocity context for the getStatHtml() method in CustomFieldSearcherModuleDescriptor with parameters from getVelocityParameters from CustomFieldType.  This allowed plugin writers to provide custom params for rendering the 'label' template for a CustomFieldSearcher.  In JIRA 4.0+ this no longer seems to be the case making it impossible to provide custom objects for the rendering of label templates for stattable custom field searchers.
fields.summary: getStatHtml() does not populate velocity context with objects from the customfield
Cannot Update Issue Assigned to Disabled User via SOAP

fields.description:
Hello Guys,

I've confirmed this bug through this ticket: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-71025

It is easily reproduceable: In any issue, go in Log Work, and in the Work Description, put a text containing carriage returns. Although the "Preview" button renders the text correctly, one you input the text, and go into the ticket, under Work Log tab, the text replaces Carriage Returns for spaces.

Could reproduce this behaviour in both 4.2.1 and 4.2.2.

Cheers
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Carriage Return does not work well at Work Description, under Log Work

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23437].
  {panel}

Actually the custom fields are enclosed by <div> tags without a unique id during using JavaScript.
It makes boring some customisations that you need to identify a specific field, like show or hide specific custom fields.
So, It's a good idea link specific custom fields enclosed by a <ID> with unique ID's, like was in past.

(Relates to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-70955)
fields.summary: Adding an ID to the div tag to customControlHeader (Version 4.2.2)

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the possibility to have a dynamic FixVersion field in the JQL search string.

For example, a developer is working with issues in a specific release version and instead of -manually- updating the search filter from FixVersion/s='1.10.01' to '1.10.02' when 1.10.01 is released and work will start on next release 1.10.02 - it could happen automatically with 'show latest unreleased version in 1.10'.
fields.summary: JQL dynamic search where fixVersion is automatically updated to latest unresolved version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23432].
  {panel}

A freshly installed JIRA 4.2.2 deployment lays out the database {{<Resource>}} tag in {{$JIRA_INSTALL/conf/server.xml}} like this:

{code:xml}
<Resource name="jdbc/JiraDS" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"

	driverClassName="org.hsqldb.jdbcDriver"
	url="jdbc:hsqldb:${catalina.home}/database/jiradb"
	username="sa"
	password=""

	minEvictableIdleTimeMillis="4000"
	timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis="5000"
	maxActive="20"
/>
{code}

And the {{<Connector>}} tag like this:

{code:xml}
<Connector port='8080'

	maxThreads="150"
	minSpareThreads="25"
	maxSpareThreads="75"
	connectionTimeout="20000"

	enableLookups="false"
	maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
	protocol="HTTP/1.1"
	useBodyEncodingForURI="true"
	redirectPort="8443"
	acceptCount="100"
	disableUploadTimeout="true"/>
{code}

Nice and clean and easy to read.

After running the {{config.sh}} tool, they're rewritten into a single line, with the keys being changed so they're in alphabetical order:

{code:xml}
<Resource auth="Container" driverClassName="com.mysql.jdbc.Driver" maxActive="20" name="jdbc/JiraDS" password="password" type="javax.sql.DataSource" url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/jira_db?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8" username="username" validationQuery="select 1"/>
{code}

{code:xml}
<Connector acceptCount="100" connectionTimeout="20000" disableUploadTimeout="true" enableLookups="false" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" maxSpareThreads="75" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" port="8080" protocol="HTTP/1.1" redirectPort="8443" useBodyEncodingForURI="true"/>
{code}

This makes them exceedingly hard to read. It'd be much better if the config tool kept the same formatting layout as the {{server.xml}} file begins with by default.
fields.summary: config.sh tool strips formatting and whitespace from tags, makes it much harder to read afterwards
Allow for multiple url prefixes and suffixes in HelpUtil

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Services#Services-CreateIssueHandler states "if this parameter is set, emails addressed to anyone other than the specified recipient will be deleted."

However this appears to be incorrect according to source code and also JRA-15580.
fields.summary: Documentation for catchemail is incorrect.

fields.description:
I'm trying to get all filters shared in a group. My process logs into JIRA using a generic user that belongs to the group from I want to get shared filters. 

This is what I'm doing: 

filters as RemoteFilter[]

// Retrieve available filters
getSavedFilters this.jira
    using in0 = this.token
    returning filters = savedFiltersReturn


This have been working fine for a long time in a previous JIRA version.
fields.summary: getSavedFilters does not return all shared filters from a group. It only returns filters created by the user logged in
Validators should be able to have "OR" logic just like Conditions

fields.description:
Tested Browsers: Firefox 3.6.13 , IE 8.0.7600.16385

Steps to reproduce:
# Create or Generate > 400 filters.
# Navigate to _Issues> Manage filters_, Click on Favorite and My tab respectively
|

Results:
*Firefox*
# Unresponsive error pop out (image below) after few seconds (~5s).
!firefox.PNG!
#firefox works normally few seconds (~5s) after click continue.
|

*IE 8*
# Unresponsive error pop out (image below) after few seconds (~5s).
!ie8.PNG!
# Warning keep popping out if continue to run the script (Click no) and UI is non responsive and unclickable.
|
fields.summary: A huge number of filters causes the Manage Filters page to become slow and unresponsive

fields.description:
When you have lots of Versions into a project, it may throw an "Unresponsive Script" in the user browser because the browser isn't being able to render the script.

This happens when you click to expand the drop down menu at Fix and Affected Versions for example.

One possible workaround would be instead of trying to expand the content, just start typing part of the version text.
fields.summary: Browser stop due to unresponsive script with large number of items in Autocomplete field renderer

fields.description:
We currently have projects that are made up of other projects.  We use filters to find bugs on the top-level project by filtering in all the bugs on the sub-projects that the top-level project is made up of.

Example.

Project - Aeroplane(version 2.0) is made up of Projects Aeroplane(Version 2.0), Wings(version 1.0) and Engine(1.2)


Using a JQL filter to find bugs works well.  However, when trying to create release notes for Aeroplane version 2.0, we do not capture the issues that were fixed in Wings version 1.0 and Engine version 1.2.  We can extract these issues easily using a filter.  However, the filter does not offer a TEXT view that can be used to simply copy and paste the results into a txt file.  A release notes view for the filter results that uses the release notes template would be ideal for people who wish to generate hierarchical release notes using filters.

Replicating every sub-project issue into the top-level project is a time consuming and causes too many replicated issues.
fields.summary: Text view for issue page returned by filter for use as hierarchical release notes

        ... 107 more

{code}

we have re-created the user in jira directly to re-assign the affected issues. but the user cannot be deleted anymore as there are still issues assigned to that account (old stuf we dont want to move).

jira should handle crowd accounts properly. it is important that issues with deleted users can still be edited or found (search with deleted users consequently does not work either)
fields.summary: Jira does not handle deleted users wih assigned issues

fields.description: JIRA has a set of custom AUI overrides in global-static.css. What this means is that plugins cannot rely on AUI to get the look and feel defined in our documentation.
fields.summary: Remove custom AUI overrides

fields.description:
The "Create Sub-task" Icon does not show if user does not have the "Edit Issues permission" for JIRA 4.1.x and 4.2.x.
See screenshot: with_edit_issue_permission.png and without_edit_issue_permission.png

For JIRA 4.0.x, there won't be any Add Subtask button for this error as in the screenshot: subtask_jira_4.0.x.png
fields.summary: "Create Sub-task" icon does not appear if don't have "Edit Issues permission"

fields.description:
G'day again Nick,

Jira is working fine now, just needed to sort out a couple of plugin issues but it seems to be chugging along nicely now. Was in light use last week with little in the way of complaints (one was I forgot the SVN plugin), it'll see normal use this week.

I don't know if it helps from your side, but the two Atlassian pages that helped the most were:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Starting+JIRA+Standalone+automatically+on+Linux
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Setting+up+JIRA+Standalone+and+MySQL+on+Linux

Points that I wasn't quite prepared for that were of note

* starting jira with sudo is a good way to cause weird problems later (as root starts to own bits of the app directory)
* uninstalling a plugin (fisheye) means repacking a .jar file without it
* SQL database should be made with InnoDB and utf-8 defaults (this is mentioned in the comments of the above page but not in the main text)
* the jira log tells you when it's ready for viewing (watching it with "less +F" was very helpful), which really helps when you're wondering when the xml import is finished (~20min for us)
* the xml import process doesn't bring across the SVN password for the SVN plugin - that had to be re-entered, though the rest of the settings were imported
fields.summary: improvements to Linux installation docs

fields.description:
People leave.  They get fired.  They die.

But through all that they are still in Jira.  We change their password to a random one, and edit the email address. But this still clutters up our lists of assignable users, and occasionally results in a dearly departed getting assigned an issue.  Jira prevents us from deleting them:

{panel}
This user cannot be deleted at this time because there are issues assigned to them, they have reported issues, or they are currently the lead of a project.
Please note that any components with this user set as the lead will have the component lead set to empty when the user is deleted.
{panel}

I am aware that we can bulk assign the reporter to someone else... but then we loose valuable at a glance history.  What we'd like is to really disable the users, without deleting them.

There are many dupes of this report, most closed as "won't fix".
fields.summary: CLONE - Alternate to "delete user" -- leave user in Jira but actually disable

fields.description:
Installation instructions:

1.	DBA need to apply oracle recommended patch(8338443) for Cramer RP security policy (GETCURRENTCONTEXTFILTER)conflicts with Materialized views. Hemang Patel is aware of this. for this need 30 mins down time.
2.	Revoke the grant EXEMPT ACCESS POLICY to gcp_user.
3.	Load GETCURRENTCONTEXTFILTER policy file under the CRAMER schema only.. (/appl/ipag/GCP_MV_HF/GCP_MV_6273.zip/cramer).
4.	Unzip the file and load Sqlfunctions.sql under gcp_user schema. (/appl/ipag/GCP_MV_HF/GCP_MV_6273.zip/functions).
5.	Unzip the file and load all sql under gcp_user schema. (/appl/ipag/GCP_MV_HF/GCP_MV_6273.zip/gcp_user).
6.	This needs to be deployed in SIT2 only.
fields.summary: JIRA for DF 6273. RP module from Cramer implementation had an impact on the GCP MV scripts.  The problems were stopping the successful execution of the scripts and subsequently the tables were not being refreshed.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Login to JIRA with few gadgets
# Refresh JIRA Dashboard few times (10)
# Observe result in Task manager.

Tested browser:
# IE 8.0.6001.18702 (XP)
# IE 8.0.7600.16385 (WIN 7)
# Firefox 3.6 (XP)

Result:
# 310 MB on IE 8.0.6001.18702 .
# 504 MB on IE 8.0.7600.16385.
# 120 MB on Firefox 3.6.
fields.summary: High Memory Consumption in IE 8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23417].
  {panel}

Please provide a localised dropdown list of <div id="filter.subscription.prefix.runOnce"> in FilterSubscription page.

By current settings are:
{code}
jira.lf.date.time = HH:mm
jira.lf.date.day = EEEE HH:mm
jira.lf.date.complete = dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm
jira.lf.date.dmy = dd.MM.yyyy
jira.lf.date.relativize = true

jira.date.picker.java.format = dd.MM.yyyy
jira.date.picker.javascript.format = %e.%m.%Y

jira.date.time.picker.java.format = dd.MM.yyyy HH:mm
jira.date.time.picker.javascript.format = %e.%m.%Y %H:%M

jira.date.time.picker.use.iso8061 = true
{code}

but they will not affect this page, so there is a usability break for german native speakers with english mask Elements ;/

If there is already an issue for that, feel free to close this, can't find one at this time.
fields.summary: Localisation of FilterSubscription page not possible

fields.description:
The value of versions/components (and other fields that utilise the FC) is prepended with a string and then used in the class attribute of the dropdowns. This class is used for selenium tests. Inserting a double quote character in a version/component breaks the FC dropdown (see screenshot). We should be using data-attributes instead of overloading the class attribute. Allowing invalid characters to be inserted into the class attribute can cause of breakages with markup rendering or JS traversal.

In the test data we have a Component named: <iframe src="http://www.atlassian.com"></iframe>
fields.summary: Frother Control can break due to content used in class attributes
Attachment dialog needs some chrome love

fields.description: The Component Lead value is aligned to the middle instead of the top. Shouldn't be smaller than the other text either.
fields.summary: Component lead alignment incorrect on the Components tab of the Project page
Component link title unnecessarily long
Lock account after multiple login failure

fields.description:
If a user, say Alice, creates and saves a filter (intending on sharing it with other users) but doesn't specify any explicit column order for the filter, it can cause confusion if another user, say Bob, has customised their own column order. Alice's filter may have been set up on the assumption that her columns are already set in a specific order, and she doesn't realise that Bob isn't going to see the same columns unless she _explicitly_ sets the column order in her filter.

Something as simple as a message pointing this out, that shows when you're creating a filter, would make it a lot more obvious and reduce confusion.
fields.summary: Add a message when saving a filter if the column order hasn't been explicitly set

fields.description: The log work bunch of fields isn't clearing the content before it correctly. The border appears below icons (see screenshot).
fields.summary: Icons display over the top of Time Tracking border

fields.description:
If a user has Edit permission but not Move permission, they cannot change the issue type of an issue using Move.
However, they can convert the issue to a subtask and then convert the subtask to an issue of any type they like.
This allows users without the Move permission to change the issue type of an issue.

Perhaps the Move permission is not intended to restrict changes to the issue type, but it certainly is the most common way that this is done by users.
fields.summary: Can subvert the Move permission using Convert to Subtask

fields.description: See enclosed example where 1 issue is shown with the headline saying: "Showing 1 to 6 of 6 issues".
fields.summary: If a summary includes <script> , it will not be shown in issuelists and the last issue on the list will be the issue with <script>

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be a interessting idea if it could be possible to have a leader associated to a group.

There is the same model for project, you can have different users able to modify the members of a project.
However, groups are still editable by the administrator only.

It would be nice to have a administration screen accessible to group leader where a user (or a list of user) could associate or disassociate people from groups.
fields.summary: Delegate group admin to specific users

fields.description:
When users enter list of users they want to add as watchers to an issue, the "Add" button suppose to be activated by keyboard shortcuts.
Unfortunately, this shortcuts are not used by JIRA but rather a different command in the browser is activated. I have tried this on both Firefox & Internet explorer and on both Windows & Linux operating systems.

The shortcut keys are as follows:

Fire fox --> Alt + Shift + 's'
Internet Explorer --> Alt + 's'
fields.summary: Submit form keyboard shortcut ignored on the watchers page
